intro: Jacobinia sericea, commonly known as silky jacobinia, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its soft, silky hairs that cover its stems and leaves, giving it a distinctive appearance. Its flowers are typically pink or white, with five petals and a prominent yellow center. Jacobinia sericea is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and showy blooms.
